hero.eyebrow: For final-year students and recent graduates
hero.title: Launch your career without pretending you have it all figured out
hero.subtitle: We help you explore options, speak confidently to employers and build habits that keep learning alive.

secondaryCta.label: Share with a parent or mentor

card.title: Graduate launch
card.description: Launch your first role with clear direction, interview practice, and steady routines.
benefits: Name your values, strengths, and constraints.
Create experiments before choosing a direction.
Build grounding routines for your first role.

key_points.title: Who it is for
key_points.description: Graduates who want structured support while choosing or starting their first role.

items.title: Students approaching graduation
items.description: You are juggling dissertations, applications and expectations from family or sponsors.

items.title: Graduates in their first 12 months
items.description: You want to process what is happening at work and decide how to respond intentionally.

items.title: Career explorers
items.description: You are testing multiple directions and want a reflective partner who will not force a single path.

process.title: Process
process.description: A focused eight-session series with optional group drop-ins during recruitment seasons.

steps.title: Orientation & goal setting
steps.description: We map the expectations around you and define what progress will look like for this season.

steps.title: Experiment & practice
steps.description: We prototype applications, networking conversations and decision scenarios so you can learn safely.

steps.title: Landing & reflection
steps.description: We review offers, onboarding experiences and learning rhythms so you stay grounded.

process.note: Parents or sponsors can fund the programme, but sessions remain confidential to the graduate.

boundaries.title: Boundaries & consent
boundaries.description: We respect that early-career decisions are intertwined with family, finance and wellbeing.

items.question: Who leads the agenda?
items.answer: The graduate does. Sponsors can align on logistics, but coaching conversations stay private.

items.question: How do you treat productivity?
items.answer: We design systems around neurodiversity, health and money realities without judgement or shaming.

items.question: What if anxiety becomes overwhelming?
items.answer: We pause coaching and connect you with clinical or wellbeing support when therapy would serve you better.

items.question: Can parents join part of a session?
items.answer: We can set up joint check-ins to align on logistics while keeping coaching conversations confidential.

items.question: Do you help with assessment centres?
items.answer: Yes. We rehearse group exercises, presentations and reflective questions relevant to your applications.

items.question: Is there support after I accept a job?
items.answer: We offer optional monthly or quarterly check-ins as you settle into the role.

cta.title: Want support choosing or starting well?
cta.description: Tell us where you are in the process and we will recommend a pace and structure that fits.
